description: Fisheries and Oceans Canada’s Salmonid Enhancement Program (SEP) delivers the Community Involvement Program (CIP) with the intent of providing technical support to salmon enhancement projects and habitat enhancement/restoration projects undertaken by local community groups and volunteers. Fisheries and Oceans Canada requires contractors to assist in the delivery of the Stream to Sea Program and to provide biotechnical support and assistance to CIP community groups to ensure CIP projects are carried out in a technically sound manner. Bio-technical support is required year round...
full_summary:
### Biological and Technical Support Services
#### South Coast - Campbell River and Mainland Inlets
------------------------------------------------

### Contract Details
### Reference: PW-22-01005236
### Amendment: 9th
### Solicitation: 30003202
------------------------------------------------

#### Dates
*   Publication Date: 2022-08-24
*   Tender Closing Date: 2022-09-07T13:00:00
*   Amendment Date: 2022-08-30
------------------------------------------------

#### Description
Fisheries and Oceans Canada's Salmonid Enhancement Program (SEP) aims to provide biological and technical support to salmon enhancement projects and habitat restoration projects carried out by local community groups and volunteers. The organiation also conducts a formal education program, the Stream to Sea Program. The program involves informing students from Kindergarten to Grade 12, as well as First Nations, local communities and external parties, about cooperative fisheries and watershed stewardship practices.

#### Services Required
The contractor is expected to provide:

*   Bio-technical support year-round as determined by geographic region, tasks may vary by season.
*   Fish production, habitat restoration, salmon stock assessment, education and awareness, and administration services.

#### Geographic Areas
The following geographic areas are covered:

*   Campbell River and Mainland Inlets

#### Eligibility
Fisheries and Oceans Canada is inviting qualified contractors to participate in this project.

#### Selection Criteria
The selection criteria are based on the following factors:

*   Business experience relevant to the project.
*   Technical capacity relevant to the project.
*   Past performance relevant to the project.
*   Operations, management, and administration relevant to the project.

#### Evaluation Factors
The evaluation of contractor proposals will be based on the following factors:

*   Technical Approach (40%).
*   Relevant Business Experience (20%).
*   Cost Management (20%).
*   Past Performance (20%).

#### Evaluation Procedure
The evaluation procedure involves a two-stage evaluation process, with short-listed candidates undergoing a more comprehensive evaluation.

#### Support Documents
The bid document consists of the following files as attachments:
